TopicTitle: Post Your Rovers/Landers Here! Megathread (stock please)

Articles.Content:
Hello, All. I am Dennislinux, and is desperate for rovers/landers for upcoming missions. If you are suggesting a rover/lander in this thread, please kindly post:

1. name of the rover/lander

2. action group bindings

3. usage

4. manned or unmanned

5. screenshot

6. save

The Linux Rovers.corp will thank your efforts of creating rovers!

I'll get my Duna return rover up tomorrow.

For now, I'm tired and I going to bed.
THanks for your effort! The Linux Rover.corpÃ‚Â® pleads to recruit you.

Official hiring board:

applicants! The Linux Rover.corpÃ‚Â® is recruiting talented, creative, innovative people ! if you are to apply for this glorious place (we will need test pilots and engineers) please fill in:

1. name

2. which job (it is engineer or test pilot)

thanks!

Linux Rover.corpÃ‚Â® CEO, Dennislinux:cool:

we are recruiting 25 test pilots and 30 engineers!

(if there are too many applying, you will be asked to put your best rover onto the post. if you are a test pilot, there are no such requirements.)
our first reserved applicant is giggleplex777! (if you read this, please choose your occulation. you are HIRED!)

I made 2 rovers;

The first one is simply named "Universal Manned Rover." It's designed to go anywhere do, practically anything, and I just rename it according to where it lands and what job it has. It's obviously manned. It resembles a pickup truck, able to carry cargo or 4 passengers in the back, it comes with a variety of tools as well as a drill bit for minor excavation in the front;

The second one is the MULE, it is an acronym for Multi Use Leviathan and Extractor. It is a 3 story vehicle capable of towing a base (designed for my Mun Base) if necessary. It can be piloted remotely (unmanned), the main components (batteries, generators, etc) are housed within the large square compartment in the center. A driver can sit in the cockpit at the bottom of the vehicle. There is also a separate compartment for passengers in the rear, ready as emergency housing. It is also designed for excavation missions.

Thanks! you are also recruited as an engineer! interested?

and can you give me the .craft file?

recruit rooster

Bacondiety

giggleplex

ROFLcoper64bit

Edited April 25, 2013 by dennislinux

ok. then can you kindly start to make your station of awesomeness (linux station?)please?

ok. then can you kindly start to make your station of awesomeness (linux station?)please?
